column5: What is best bet in Geraldton for groceries....bread in particular. Want it to be as fresh as possible but don't want to get to Geraldton and find out they are sold out. Has anyone ever had issues like that???

There is a No Frills and Daneff's Food Market.You should be fine.I am pretty sure we shopped at the No Frills. It's a huge chain discount food market in Canada.https://www.nofrills.ca/store-locato...mpaign=Loblawshttp://www.daneffsfoodmarket.ca/#oneclickaboutusOtherwise, buy it ahead of time and freeze it. I've done that plenty of times too.If you want it really fresh, bake some! No Knead bread is pretty easy to make. Ideally you want a dutch oven, but a cookie sheet turned over and a stainless steel bowl as a lid works.https://www.thekitchn.com/how-to-mak...ad-home-109343

It is a large store, so the chances of them being out of bread are slim. I stopped buying there since they stopped accepting Visa cards. I now buy the food which I purchase in Canada (Canadian bread being a favorite) such as bread, vegetables, milk, and eggs, from a large store, forgot the name, on Arthur St, several blocks east of the highway in Thunder Bay. Bill
We love the "Canadian Rye" bread. Usually stock up in Ft Frances.
